name: Maduros (Fried Sweet Plantains)

ingredients.name: very ripe
ingredients.original_string: 2 very ripe, blackened plantains (about 6 ounces each)

ingredients.name: neutral oil, such as vegetable
ingredients.original_string: Neutral oil, such as vegetable or canola oil, for frying

instructions: Use a paring knife to cut a slit along the length of the plantains, carefully avoiding cutting into the flesh. Remove peels and discard. Slice plantains at an angle crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick pieces (about 12 pieces per plantain).

In a large skillet, heat about 1/8 inch vegetable oil over medium-high. When the oil shimmers, add half the sliced plantains and fry until golden brown, turning once, 2 to 3 minutes per side. The plantains should be caramelized and slightly crisp at the edges but still tender in the middle.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer maduros to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with remaining sliced plantains. Serve immediately.
